request_pathways.name: Authorization for Release of Protected or Privileged Health Information
Fax submission to Release of Information office
Mail submission to Release of Information office

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patients use a general-purpose HIPAA authorization form (selecting 'Personal' as purpose) to request their own records, which must be submitted via mail or fax.

red_flags: Mandatory date specification for every record type with no 'all records' option may burden patients seeking comprehensive access
Two outdated non-fillable versions remain publicly accessible at legacy URLs
bright_spots: 78 fillable interactive fields in current form version — comprehensive digital completion
Four delivery methods including patient portal and secure email
Granular opt-in consent for seven categories of sensitive information
Clear voluntary authorization and non-coercion statement

findability.rationale: Level 4: Easy to find with basic web search returning direct PDF links; minor concern that older versions persist at legacy URLs, but current form is prominently available.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 4: Mostly digital workflow — 78 fillable fields enable complete digital form completion, but submission requires fax (which counts as electronic), creating one gap in the end-to-end digital workflow.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized A–E section structure across 2 pages with clear headers and logical flow; minor issues include mandatory date specification and some dense regulatory language in Section D.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: A patient can use the process by selecting 'Personal' and checking the self-mail box, but the form was designed for third-party release — no Right of Access language, no dedicated patient pathway, and patients must navigate which parts apply to them.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: No notarization required, clear voluntary authorization and non-conditioning language, 6-month expiration with override option; minor ambiguity around fee applicability for patient self-access requests.

overall.summary: MGH offers a technically well-executed fillable authorization form that is easy to find and free of major barriers, but the lack of a dedicated patient access pathway and reliance on a generic third-party release form limit patient-centeredness.
